content: > visit my ravelry group designs by > emily wood 1 for pattern support > and to sign up to receive > notifications about news pattern > releases and upcoming kals the charmayne shawl starts with a few stitches and grows toward the far side it has a stockinette body with a lacy border running along the bottom edge and finishes with another wide border of lace along the final edge instructions for the shawl come in two sizes the smaller size has a narrower lace border and incorporates beads optional the pattern includes instructions for increasing or decreasing the size of the shawl **finished sizes ** 58 60 / 147 152 5 cm in length and 16 21 / 40 5 53 cm wide at its widest point **yarn ** small beaded sample shown in manos del uruguay fino 70% merino 30% silk 490 yd/450 m per 100g skein color inkwell 1 skein large green shawl shown in wollmeise twin 80% superwash merino 20% nylon 510 yd/466 m per 150g skein color löwenzahn 1 skein **needles ** small size us size 4 3 5 mm 24 / 60cm or longer circular needle large size us size 5 3 75 mm 24 / 60cm or longer circular needle **gauge ** 24 sts x 38 row = 4 in st st with manos del uruguay fino on us size 4 3 5 mm needles 22 sts x 32 row = 4 in st st with wollmeise twin on us size 5 3 75 mm needles **notions ** stitch marker 50 g approx 660 6/0 seed beads optional crochet hook for placing beads as required the pattern has been translated into danish here https //strikkeglad dk/18426/charmayne/ 1 https //www ravelry com/groups/designs-by-emily-wood
